case.state: A few of my colleagues have mentioned this place in passing. So, why not give it a shot?
Have I seen that young man before? Maybe he mentioned someone by that description?
Oh, please...
{style1} I simply despise that name...
Ah, good to see you again. I certainly hope that you've been able to make use of that little `trinket'.

I don't drink often, but it does sound good about now...!
I didn't bring a good wetsuit! Shame, that water looks so inviting!

Did I get the right location? Well, someone else is here so it must be.
This should prove to be a very educational endeavor!
Hopefully this should offer a chance for data...

I'll need to get some data on emotional reactions `in situ', I hope no one minds.
I'm not just interested in Pok√©mon battles, obviously!
I've heard of Ditto mimicking humans. This could be the case.
Duplicates? Probably Dittos. I could have Porygon-Z fight them to be sure...
Is this some sort of new Rotom form?
You know...this is rather unsafe.
I didn't expect this!
This seems extremely reckless!
Is the entire street cordoned off for this?
(That hair, could that be...did that man have a...)
That hair color...no, that can't be the case.
This young man looks...so familiar...
Well now, this is certainly curious.
Don't I know you from somewhere...?
That hat...weren't you at the Aether Paradise when...?
Aren't you Miss Lillie's friend?
Oh, is this a new Rotom form, perhaps?
This is unique.
How...fascinating!
Oh, weren't you in the PWT? A shame we couldn't battle.
(I was hoping no one else from Unova would be here...)
Electric-types are quite nice. I always felt you had amazing taste.
Mostly, I just wanted to play Poker. The `strip` part I could take or leave, really.
Well, you seem very enthusiastic...though I don't plan on being the one losing today!
You're...that bizarre gentleman I've seen around Alola, yes?
What was that group's name...Death's Head?
Wait. You're...
Rosa? How long has it been...? (And why is she here of all places?!)
(Wiki...as in the free online encyclopedia that anyone can edit...?)
As in an online encyclopedia?
I knew I was picking up some strange readings...this definitely confirms my theory.
Instantaneous travel between worlds! Greetings! Or `Alola!', if you prefer!
Have I seen that young man before? Maybe he mentioned someone by that description?
Another scientist? This should be an interesting match...
Have I seen you before?
Marvelous! This should prove to be a most enjoyable endeavor!
This is excellent. Exciting, even! This place is proving to be just full of surprises!
~target~, is it? I'll remember your name.
It is rather strange that some people weren't aware...
They don't know? The Grunts seemed to consider it the entire selling point!
Odd, the Grunts simply wouldn't talk about anything but the forfeit...
I believe you're mistaken...
You can't hold this young man responsible for the actions of him...
(Could he have really involved his own flesh and blood in Team Plasma...?)
Honestly, I should be the one bearing more of the blame...on paper, I was the leader...
I won't stand here and let you blame him for all of this.
I feel like the chlorine might be problematic...
You'll have to beat me if you want to see that.
Well vampirism is actually fairly common in nature-
A church that bans the use of machines? That seems so...despotic!
This seems like a place I might be interested in discovering...
My, do you work a laboratory? That sounds quite exciting!
That sounds so interesting...I mean, quite a pain!
Perhaps your viewers would appreciate a scientific discussion?
There are some people out there that I would rather not have my location...
Weren't you at the Aether Paradise when...?
I'm certain I've seen that outfit before...
You were with that `Maxie` gentleman who tried to take the Aether Paradise, weren't you...?
I'm surprised to see one of you showing your face...
Not really a 'routine' persay. Though I do tend to do a lot of walking these days...
A rather odd question. Does lifting machinery in a laboratory count?
Oh dear...this isn't good.
I certainly hope I'm wrong...
That really is her...
Interesting, I have heard of Pokemon able to mimic human enunciation, but would have thought insectoid mandibles to be unsuited to the task...
Ah, a Butterfree? Or perhaps...an entirely new species?
Though perhaps this isn't a Pokemon, and just fauna?
I certainly hope that you've not been misleading anyone, ~player~.
My Rotom Dex is buzzing...is there something behind her only it can see...?
"That white hand on your shoulder...I'm just imagining it."
Something behind you? Something cloaked, perhaps?
I...I'm sorry, I was lost in thought. (I don't want to believe it, but...)
(Perhaps I'll just not mention it...)
Hold still please, I need to calibrate the spectroradiometer-
Wavelength appears to be between 450 and 495 nm...obviously in the middle.
I didn't expect to see something like this! Amazing! That's amazing!
I'm not familiar, but I'm happy to meet you.
It seems like a rather odd reason to come to a place like this...but I suppose mine is too.
Oh, just as an aside, happy Pokemon Day!
Today is Pokemon Day! I'm not sure why that is.
It's always nice to see someone enjoying themselves! Good to meet you, too!
My, aren't you a curious one? I appreciate your enthusiasm!
If you insist on this, I will enjoy taking you down a peg...
You certainly have his confidence. I sincerely doubt you have the power to back that up...
Well, it's a little unconventional, but I've been meaning to take a break!
Luckily I decided to reinforce my machines against humid environments!
The water looks inviting. Maybe once the game is over I'll indulge a bit.
(Is everyone from Unova here? Really? I think I might be in trouble.)
Did you plan this, ~player~?
Well, for the rest of you...my name is Colress! I believe ~player~ and I are acquainted fairly well already...
Nice to meet you, everyone, my name is Colress. ~player~ and I are friends, you could say.
I have to warn you, ~player~, I've been brushing up on my Poker skills!
As strange as our last encounter was, I'm still quite happy to see you, ~player~.
Now, my goal is to gather information on how humans interact with one another. Feel free to express yourself as you see fit.
In order to properly quantify my theories, I will need your full support...
I accept your challenge, ~player~. This should prove highly enlightening!
Did you know that many computers are capable of playing Poker? I'd say I've gotten fairly handy with it...
Greetings! My name is Colress. I'm a Pokemon researcher. I'm absolutely ecstatic to meet you!
Now I've never played the strip kind of Poker, but computer Poker?
(Oh...not quite...misplaced a decimal...)
(I want to correct him! But that would be cheating...)
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, that seems smart...
I would say...~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Taking into account the probability...~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Probability really is the determining factor here...so, crunching the numbers...
Hold on, let me just run the numbers...um, ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer. That seems logical.
How about ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~? I'm certain luck is on my side.
I've run the probabilities, I'm confident that this will pay off!
`Luck' has nothing to do with it. It's all math!
I have a feeling ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ will work well for me...
~cards.text~, please. Let's not delay.
Well, I've been in worse situations before!
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~...please. Thank you.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~. Time to get serious.
Oh, ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, if you please...
I'm certain I can draw out the power of ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~...
It's important to never give up. I certainly don't plan to do so!
You know, it's probably more accurate to say a `lucky' man generates his own good fortune...
`Luck' is all about listening to your intuition.
Alright, the key to battling and the key to poker is to think critically.
Ah, I'm sure this will pay off.
I wonder what the probability of each hand is.
I've done the math, this seems like the best course of action.
I'm confident that these calculations are going to be much more accurate!
Could I get ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, please?
Regardless of what happens, this has been quite entertaining.
Let's see...~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Regardless of the outcome, at least I'm enjoying myself!
I can't rush these things. No, let's take things slowly and methodically.
~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, thank you.
Now, let's see this plan come together.
I'll go with ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Let's see if this hypothesis proves true!
Discipline is important for a poker player. I can at least muster some for this.
Hopefully ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ will work well for me...
~cards.text~, please...
As bad as things may look, I'm certain I can turn things around!
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~...please.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~. Let's make this quick.
Do you think I'm out of this game? I disagree.
Oh, it seems you're also taking notes?
Ah, Meia, it seems you're taking your own data.
I wonder if you were in my...situation...
So, a rather...awkward...hypothetical, if you'd been involved in something bad...say, capturing a mythical creature...
So, hypothetically, if a person you hated asked you to help them, and they were offering something useful to you...you would, right?
Let's say that hypothetically you'd done something terribly wrong in the past...how would you go about trying to make amends?
I certainly hope you're not doing this on a school night. Your education is important.
Oh, are you...a student? What are you studying? I surely hope you're doing well! There's always so much to learn!
I'll have to have my Colress machine MK II run the binomial coefficients...
Ah, the laws of probability appear to be working in my favor.
Splendid!
Is this good result simply a random event, or does positive thinking really make it better?
The odds are complex, but I believe I have a handle on it now.
Perhaps I have it now...
There, the MkII should be able to run the coefficients more accurately.
I believe I've corrected for any errors in my previous approach!
I don't know if it affects chance, but being positive certainly makes me feel better about this!
(This breeze is provoking some...bizarre thoughts...but I think I'm safe for now.)
(I know very well the consequence of losing...I can avoid that.)
It may look dire, but I can still go on!
Ah, is this the power of positive thinking?
It's always nice when things pay off...
Ah, very good. This is what I was hoping for.
Ah, my calculations paid off!
I love it when a hypothesis proves true.
Ah, an impeccable strategy.
Ah, there we are, that will do.
If I keep succeeding like this, the truth of my theory will be evident to all!
I see! This works as well.
Ah, I've definitely stumbled onto a working strategy this time!
I'm more psyched than I've ever been! I can still go on!
I'm wondering why I didn't have this hand earlier? Oh well.
This is adequate...but only just.
This is passable.
This is adequate. It should be better.
There's a saying about beggars and choosers here, I believe.
This hand is passable. I should strive for better!
As always, I need to strive for better.
Inconclusive.
An inconclusive result is worse than a failed hypothesis.
This really isn't an effective use of cards.
(Luck seems to have a greater factor in this than I thought.)
(I didn't think nudity would be this much of a distraction.)
Indeed, I'm having trouble deciding what to do next.
Mm, uncertainty is the worst outcome.
I won't be discouraged by this!
I suppose beggars can't be choosers?
I could work with this. If I had to.
I'm not used to going off so little information.
I guess this is passable.
The top of the Gaussian curve. Perfectly average.
I suppose I could still make this work!
Results: inconclusive.
I really hate uncertainty.
I suppose this could work...
At times like this, at least I have optimism!
Well, if I must.
And yet, I'm left with more questions.
This could work.
I suppose this is one of the most likely outcomes of a draw.
I'll make the most of this, I'm certain.
This wasn't exactly what I was looking for.
If I'd believed more, could I have gotten something a bit better?
Of course, not all experiments end the way you'd like.
This is...not exactly ideal.
Well...sometimes one must make do.
It's hard even for me to make use of this material...
Well, this is...unfortunate.
Dealer, can I say you're upsetting me quite a bit right now?
This is completely unacceptable.

You'll have to forgive my rudeness, but this is simply unacceptable.
Hm...this is a shame.
Can we call this an outlier?
Oh, phenomenal...
How can this be...?
What is this?!
(At this rate, I may very well have to...)
(I know what's coming...and somehow I'm excited.)
If I'd believed harder, would that have fixed this hand...?
I may want to have a word with you, Dealer. After this.
Is it drafty in here? Oh. Right---
If I really tried, I suppose I could get some use out of this.
No matter how you look at it, this puts me at a disadvantage.
I suppose intelligence doesn't translate to luck...
I'm beginning to feel discouraged.
Clearly this was possible, but highly improbable.
Well, this isn't ideal, is it?
This is a rather poor outcome...
Dealer, I'm beginning to suspect some foul play. Am I over-thinking it?
Well, this hand seems like it would make someone happy.

Ah, that was clearly a misstep.
A minor setback.
Not the result I was anticipating.
Will I be able to overcome this hurdle?
I'd rather not part with another article of clothing this soon.
Surely this must be a joke?
I suppose there are no guarantees. Regardless, this isn't good.
It's a shame my Colress Machine can't energize these cards.
Well, I doubt it would mean much from a stranger, but I hope you have a wonderful day!

You're doing great! Any new skill takes time and effort to learn!
None of my Pokemon or my machines were caught in the middle of that! Everything is functioning fine here!
That was less than pleasant, but I'm certain I would have felt it if...
You don't need to respond if you don't wish to. We all have some memories we'd rather leave behind.
I can understand that. There are thing I'd rather leave in the past.
Really, there are some things that should stay buried in the past.
(Something tells me I wasn't meant to see that.)
At what now? Sorry, I was looking at my screen...
Oh, congratulations! I hope your day is wonderful!
It's a curious way to celebrate, but a birthday really should be what you want. Congratulations!
Oh, did you bring an important picture with you? I'd advice against doing that in this kind of setting-
I have recently gotten to treat myself to this little Alolan dish called a malasada...then again, I'm not certain what type of cuisine that would be.
Oh, well, many happy returns to you!
Well, it isn't how I might spend a birthday, but it's your choice.
In Alola, Pokemon Centers will hold surprise parties for trainers on their birthdays! It's so sweet.
Hopefully it will see many more years of service!
I've always appreciated the easy internet access to encyclopedias!
Oh is it that time already? I'll send the site a donation, then!
Something about that system looks vaguely familiar...
I wouldn't mind being able to talk to Pokemon...I've never known that to be possible.
I don't think so. The Inventory seems to be very exclusive.
Oh, interesting way to spend your birthday, but I hope you have a great day regardless!
Maybe I'll treat myself to a drink or two...Ms Wicke does keep telling me I need to take a break.
Oh, there's only one contender. Genesect!
Genesect. It is, by far, the very symbol of my theories, being the perfect mingling of Pokemon ability and human innovation!
I am fond of Steel-type, but Genesect is simply superior.
That makes sense, I wouldn't consider Wailord a fish either. They're nearly 15 meters long...but only 400 or so kg! Mostly air!
Isn't it interesting that the larger these animals get, the more sluggish they tend to be? It must take quite a bit of energy to get them moving-
I've seen Staryu and Starmie do this. Corsola as well! They make it look as though nothing ever happened.
The only reason I don't gain weight during the holiday season is that I've been known to miss meals normally.
Wicke keeps insisting that I need to gain some weight.
This `cockroach' sounds a lot like a creature called Pheromosa. They actually are constantly cleaning themselves, because they think we'redirty!
We have creatures called `Muk` and `Grimer'. They break down waste like that. It does mean they have a rather undesirable smell, but...
Interesting. There are many Pokemon that break down waste, and I feel they tend to get a bad reputation. They're performing such interesting chemical reactions though.
Ugh, that sounds unpleasant!
If you're going to eat something, you should at least make things painless and quick for them.
I can't imagine eating something like a Shellos. They're so gentle.
And they say Ghosts are depressing...this one seems to be the life of the party!
My, my, someone's having fun!
Honestly, many Ghost-Types seem to be fun-loving...I wonder if that's enlightenment?
Aha...I don't fight on my own.
Faba told me I'm too enthusiastic! Can you believe that? Too enthusiastic?
Wicke tells me I'm a bit of a workaholic...I suppose that's true, but I have so much to see!
I'm mostly interested in function. Multiple layers means I can easily adapt to changing temperatures as well.
I've actually been designing some of my own clothes...I've been working on a water-cooled labcoat that contains various computer interfaces, for instance!
Well, it depends on your definition. You could argue that Magnemites or Voltorbs...well, there is Genesect...
There's no need to be self-conscious. No one here is going to judge you. At least, I'm certainly not going to!
Strange as it sounds, I thought it might help me understand more about emotional connections.
I've heard of this place from my colleagues. And at least three fellow scientists have told me to take a break this week so, why not?
I enjoy science fiction...I realize it seems odd for a scientist to be interested in a genre that doesn't often represent the subject accurately, but...
I'm currently working on 'Who Goes There?' by John Campbell Jr. It's about researchers discovering a long-dormant creature beneath the ice!
I see, a sort of energy capacitor then? Fascinating!
My apologies, but this is for scientific advancement!
I could watch from elsewhere if it would help.
I suppose I've never given that much thought. Intelligent, passionate...they have to like Pokemon of course...
(I wonder what the spring constant is for this 'ARMS' ability...)
And this doesn't affect your ability to use them? Interesting...
Oh, ma'am, you know you don't have to remove the jacket too, right?
I think that's a bit of a personal question...
You're drunk...it simply wouldn't be good to talk about it...
I wouldn't feel right talking about this while you're drunk. It seems dishonest.
I wouldn't want to talk about this with someone who couldn't...
Is that an invitation?! Pok√©mon of course! But to an extent computers and machinery. I do love inventing. Oh, but then there's also Ultra Space!
I've recently become fascinated with something called UltraSpace, which seems to enable one to cross between entire worlds in mere seconds!
How does that feel? Or does it? Is this `radiation-induced` zombification, or something more `Frankenstein`?
I must say...I absolutely despise people like you.
I disagree.
Nikola Tesla was widely believed to be asexual, and was noted to like the company of Pidgeotto more than people.
A chance to discover how ancient people may have treated their Pokemon? That would be ideal!
Oh, probably the harnessing of electricity! I simply can't talk enough about Tesla!
I'm quite fond of the 'karakuri' puppets from the 17th century. They had such complex internal mechanisms!
December 17, 1903, the first successful airplane. We simply couldn't have created the Frigate without the existing knowledge.
I don't know the exact date, but the arrival of Kyurem in Unova clearly influenced quite a bit...
Tesla! I certainly can't say enough about that man. Science for science's sake is always the most noble endeavor!
That might be...ethically questionable? Is that what the word is?
I have to warn you, whenever Plasma grunts made this wager, they always lost...
I've managed to teach my Porgyon to run a program to play it.
I tried asking Faba once, but he just got upset. I don't really understand it. He never seems to just enjoy life.
I've been very engrossed in old issues of Astounding Science Fiction lately. Have you read 'Who Goes There' by John Campbell Jr?
A bond between individuals that brings out the best in each individual. I can't really quantify it...not for lack of trying.
I'm sure there's a couch I could use.
I can imagine you might have trouble with them.
No, can't say I do. I'm quite good at biking though...
That sounds unfortunate. I've never been good with this sort of interaction.
Ah, I hadn't thought about that. Shame, I would have hoped aliens would be interested in sharing knowledge.
Indeed. I've never liked the idea of having to pay high prices to be involved in the scientific method, myself.
Oh, trust me, I understand that. You can't put a price on the opportunity to learn!
Well, I'm told I'm quite smart, and always extremely enthusiastic. Sometimes `too enthusiastic', but really that's not possible!
A bit forward. I'd say I'm very well-read!
(I'm just not going to comment. I have no idea what to say!)
Ah...well, you have to assemble a pattern of cards, and to win yours must be of higher rank than others...
Any time I have a study I'm working on. Or if I happen to see a particularly interesting Pokemon in the field. That kind of thing.
I've gotten used to the heat in Alola. What I've not yet been able to get used to is the humidity...
(What an amusing little robot. I must get one for myself.)
(Haha...it doesn't seem especially smart...but I still want one.)
I suppose they must mean something to you...
I suppose I can understand. I plan to keep my gloves...
Honestly, all of them seem to have their benefits...but Summer in Undella town always seems to bring in new travelers, and that's quite exciting!
Ooh...yes. My first night in Alola. For such colorful, fruit-flavored drinks, those are intense.
I'm told that I told everyone at the Aether Foundation how great the were...word to the wise, anything brightly colored at a bar is drowning in rum...
I can imagine. To me, though, sentience is sentience. I wouldn't consider a mechanical person any less of a person.
Now, that's simply poor sportsmanship.
I'm not actually sure. My Porygons seem to be especially interested in the place, which makes me think it might be AI or robotic...
Shrewd, very shrewd.
You're quite devious, aren't you? Clever.
I suspect I'll have to take you up on that splendid offer!
Ah, that would be art that I could truly appreciate!
Do you...do you need some help?
I've been told that I come off as being rather...impersonal. I'm simply engrossed in work.
Trying to socialize is easy so long as the other person understands my theories! Or...at least is willing to listen. So...it isn't often easy, then.
I believe we would all be using the deck that the dealer provides.
Are card games different where you come from?
Achromatic. 'Colress' comes from 'colorless'. Of course, few things are strictly black and white...
'Colorless'. I'm not certain what the thought process was behind it, but it is rather amusing!
If that really is the case, it may alter my findings somewhat...
So sure of yourself, are we?
Success is 90% persipiration, I certainly hope you're willing to back that up!
Recently I've had the luxury to study in Alola. There are these delightful things called Malasadas...
I can cook fairly well...after all, it's a must if you live alone...but I never have time for anything extravagant anymore.
A book, no one else around for miles, and the gentle hum of computers...
A cup of tea, some research notes to pour over...well, I don't know if it makes me feel 'loved' so much as peaceful-
Trying to see how many digits of pi I can name. Honestly though I rarely make it past 400.
(Fascinating piece of equipment, that thing...a bit stupid, perhaps...)
Tell him that no matter what he's promised, it's not worth it to take his offer.
The birds? I don't know of anyone who could speak to them. Some can hear their thoughts...
Can you actually speak to another species? I would be very interested to learn how that works!
Many of the inland cities in Unova tend to be a bit chilly. But towards the coastline it's quite nice!
I assume this must function as a bar of some sort. I can't imagine this is a non-profit.
Oh, for many people, Pokemon are pets! My Magnezone is 180 kg and 1.2 m of pure conductive metal and is able to use magnetic fields to float!
I see Beheeyem as more of a colleague. He communicates using colored lights and can manipulate memory-
My Metagross is more of a colleague...it has four brains in total, and it can out-think any current supercomputer.
Porygon-2 and Porygon-Z are able to move through the internet and access encrypted data! They do tend to eat your browser cookies though.
Personally I'm attracted to intelligence and passion...but I feel both have advantages.
Well, why don't you ask me to choose between cold fusion or zero-point energy?
Oh, well visualizing the concepts are important for s...wait, assassin certification?
(I'll assume I misheard the `assassin` part.) Well, understanding the concept, the why and how of something is important.
Knowledge! Or perhaps, more time to learn things. The ability to speak to Pokemon, maybe? Can I change my answer?!
I have my fair share of critics. Many of them...really do have a point, to be honest.
Oh, more than a few. Let's say that I'm not especially proud of what I once used my work for.
Multiply 500 cm and 5.5 kg, divide by 3600 and take the square root...should give me the body surface area of a Ducklett, then---
Are we calculating this solely by height and width, or BSA?
It seems like a strange way to carry Duckletts. Why not use Pokeballs?
Ooh, that's a vibrant color. I'm fond of shades of blue, obviously. Especially something more `electric' or neon. The kind that pairs well with a matte black or a nice chrome...
Discovering new things is an amazing goal to have!
I've been studying how pok√©mon and people work together. It seems to make both stronger!
I've been working in very tropical areas as of late. I have to say I've become quite fond of yellow Hibiscus.
Unfortunately, yes. I'm rather glad I'm not associated with him anymore. I can't believe I didn't realize how unhinged he was!
I see, like a text-to-speech? You seem quite advanced compared to many of those, though.
I see, like the IBM 704...
Are you familiar with the song 'Daisy Bell'? Many computers have been taught to 'sing' it...
Unova is a land of...shall we say, climate extremes? There are enormous cities, deserts and even frozen tundra. As a whole it's rather chilly though-
My world is full of wild creatures called Pokemon. For some people, Pokemon are pets. Some people train them to battle or to perform.
Feel free if you'd like. Since the 'Ultra Wormhole' thing I've been trying to catalog different worlds...
(Does she know that all of us can see that? My my...)
I know how that feels. I even wear mine to the beach!
I believe his interest was more in engineering, though he was noted for his 'eccentric' love of Pidgeotto.
I certainly believe so. Sacrifices have to be made for progress, after all...
Well, sacrifices must be made for progress, sometimes.
I wouldn't mind being able to talk to Pokemon...
I've been told that I don't take disaster too seriously. I can't help it. A disaster is just something more to be studied!
I'm told that I 'always have my eyes on a console'...
I've been told I'm somewhat 'excitable'. I simply feel there's a lot to get excited about.
My Porygon-Z! Whenever they're excited, they have this little fluttery fit! It's precious!
Oh, have you ever seen a Magnemite in a power station? They look so serene.
Once my Rotom wandered into the washing machine...they're such mischievous little scamps...
I'd offer to teach you, but that might be cheating...
Maybe after the game I could give you a few pointers...
I overheard some Aether Paradise employees talking about this place...though I'd been far too busy to take a look before now.
Word of mouth from colleagues, mostly. ~player~ happened to catch me at a time when I wasn't busy.
Hair? Voices? That's...unique.
I've heard more than my fair share of strange remarks about my hair, but that's rather new...
It's such a nice color, isn't it? Such a calming, 'cool' color...
How old are these people? Some of my usual fare might be too dark for children.
As odd as it sounds, I rather enjoy science fiction. Have you ever watched 'The Thing'?
Well, is perception reality? I'm not exactly a philosopher.
